title: Historical Performance of Consumer Portfolio Services Inc Stock During Economic Recessions and Recoveries

content.section: Overview of Consumer Portfolio Services Inc
content.text: Consumer Portfolio Services Inc (CPS) is a specialty finance company that focuses on providing indirect automobile financing to individuals with past credit problems, low incomes, or limited credit histories. The company purchases retail installment sales contracts originated by dealers in connection with the sale of automobiles, trucks, and motorcycles. CPS operates primarily in the United States. It was founded in 1991 and is headquartered in Irvine, California.

During economic recessions, specialty finance companies like CPS tend to experience challenges due to higher defaults and delinquencies in their loan portfolios. The 2008 financial crisis, for example, had a significant impact on the stock price of CPS, as it did for many other financial institutions. The stock price of CPS declined sharply from its pre-recession peak in 2007, reaching a low point in early 2009. However, CPS managed to navigate through the recession and post-recession period, gradually recovering its stock price over time.

During economic recoveries, specialty finance companies like CPS can benefit from improved credit conditions and increased lending opportunities. As the economy recovers, individuals may have better access to credit, leading to increased demand for automobile financing. This can positively impact the stock price of CPS. Additionally, as the overall financial industry improves, investor sentiment towards specialty finance companies tends to improve as well, further supporting the stock price.

Consumer Portfolio Services Inc (CPS) has shown a mixed performance during economic recessions and recoveries. The stock price tends to be negatively affected during recessions, reflecting the challenges faced by specialty finance companies in such periods. However, CPS has managed to recover from these downturns as economic conditions improve. It is important to note that the historical performance of CPS stock during economic recessions and recoveries may not necessarily predict its future performance, as numerous factors can influence stock prices and overall market conditions.
